entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hopian; akin to Middle High German hoffen to hope

def.dt: :to cherish a desire with anticipation hopes for a promotion
:trust
:to desire with expectation of obtainment
:to expect with confidence :trust
:to hope without any basis for expecting fulfillment
:trust reliance
:desire accompanied by expectation of or belief in fulfillment came in hopes of seeing you
:expectation of fulfillment or success no hope of a cure
:someone or something on which hopes are centered our only hope for victory
:something hoped for
Health Opportunity for People Everywhere
Anthony see Sir Anthony Hope hawkins
Bob 1903–2003 originally Leslie Townes Hope Am. (Brit.-born) comedian
Victor Alexander John 1887–1951 2d Marquis of Lin*lith*gowbixhop02.wavlin-!lith-(+)gO bixhop02.wavlin-ˈlith-(ˌ)gō British soldier; viceroy of India (1936–43)
:a young woman's accumulation of clothes and domestic furnishings (as silver and linen) kept in anticipation of her marriage
:a chest for such an accumulation

entry.et: by folk etymology from Dutch verloren hoop, literally, lost band

def.dt: :a body of men selected to perform a perilous service
:a desperate or extremely difficult enterprise
:a white contender for a boxing championship held by a black
:one who is felt to represent whites
:one from whom much is expected
:a person undertaking a difficult task
former province S Republic of South Africa ✽ Cape Town area 278,465 square miles (724,009 square kilometers)
